de.dipf.edutec.thriller.experiencesampling.sensorservice.transport

Class MqttService

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dipf.edutec.thriller.experiencesampling.sensorservice.transport.MqttService

  • public class MqttService
extends Object

    Provides a simplified interface to MqttAsyncClient for use by the android app.

    Also features a "repeating connect" functionality, which causes the client to retry a connection in an interval specified by RECONNECT_INTERVAL.

    Only necessary before the initial connection is established, at which point MqttAsyncClient will handle the automatic reconnect.

      • handler

        private Handler handler

      • repeatingConnect

        private Runnable repeatingConnect
        Runnable that tries to connect to the MQTT broker. If the connection fails, the runnable passes itself to a handler to be repeated every 30s. After this initial connection has been established, the connection will be managed automatically by eclipse paho`s MqttConnectOptions#setAutomaticReconnect(boolean)}.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • doConnect

        public org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.IMqttToken doConnect()
                                                    throws org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.MqttException

        Perform the actual connection operation to the MQTT broker.

        The asynchronous nature of the client was mostly not desired in the case of the connect operation; therefore, it is executed in a blocking manner through IMqttToken.waitForCompletion()`.

        The method will block until either
        1. The connection was established successfully
        2. An exception occurred during the connect operation
        Returns:
        MQTT token of the successfully established connection.
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.MqttException - if the connection to the MQTT broker fails.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(String topic,
                        byte[] content)
        Publishes a message to the MQTT broker.
        Parameters:
        topic - Topic on which the message shall be published.
        content - Content of the message.

      • connect

        public void connect()
        Connects to the MQTT broker by initiating a repeating connect handler.

      • connect

        public void connect(String username,
                    String password,
                    String url)
        Same as connect(), but with explicitly specified username, password and url.
        Parameters:
        username - User name for authentication with the MQTT broker.
        password - For authentication with the MQTT broker.
        url - Of the MQTT broker.

      • loginCheck

        public void loginCheck(String username,
                       String password,
                       String url)
                throws org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.MqttException
        Same as loginCheck(), but with explicitly specified credentials and URL.
        Parameters:
        username - User name for authentication with the MQTT broker.
        password - For authentication with the MQTT broker.
        url - Of the MQTT broker.
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.MqttException - if the broker is unavailable or the credentials are incorrect.

      • loginCheck

        public void loginCheck()
                throws org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.MqttException

        Checks if the user is able to login with the specified credentials.

        If a connection to the broker is established and the credentials are correct, the method terminates normally. In all other cases, an exception is thrown. To find out what caused the exception, the return code of the exception must be inspected.

        Throws:
        org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.MqttException - if the broker is unavailable or the credentials are incorrect.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Checks if the client is currently connected to the MQTT broker.
        Returns:
        True if connected, false if not.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects the client from the MQTT broker.

        The asynchronous nature of the client was mostly not desired in the case of the disconnect operation; therefore, it is executed in a blocking manner through IMqttToken.waitForCompletion()`.

        The method will block until either
        1. The connection closed successfully
        2. An exception occurred during the disconnect operation

      • handleException

        private void handleException(org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.MqttException me)
